availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Graddy (Versailles, Woodford Co, KY, banker)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Patsy Carlile in Woodford County on August 31, 1819. Married to Martha Graddy. Father of Margaret Graddy, Sallie Graddy, and Fanny Graddy. Farmer, manufacturer, and trader in Woodford County in 1840. Owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1840. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned seventy-five enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned fifty-three enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, 1789-1872, Film #000252320, p. 279.
